content: @WG-prioritization we have our steering meeting in ~ 53 minutes
@WG-prioritization :wave:, please react with :wave: to show who is participating
first of all, remember that we've created a HackMD team https://hackmd.io/team/rust-compiler-team?nav=overview
in order to be able to write to our documents I'd need to know your HackMD username to give you access, so please, DM me with it if you haven't been added yet
let's get started
the idea of the meeting would be to discuss about ways to keep improving our process and to plan some of our following work
for that I've added some tasks to our Master document
we've worked a bit with @apiraino and finished most of our cli automation triagebot#645
so most of our unassigned and following work is

• [ ] Implement @triagebot commands for each step of our procedure
    • [ ] Unprioritized I-prioritize pending list
    • [ ] Unprioritized Regressions pending list
    • [ ] Nominations pending list
    • [ ] PRs waiting on team pending list
    • [ ] Agenda
      • [ ] Render MCP section only
      • [ ] Render Beta nominations only
      • [ ] Render Stable nominations only
      • [ ] Render PRs waiting on team only
      • [ ] Render Issues of note short summary only
      • [ ] Render Issues of note P-critical only
      • [ ] Render Issues of note Unassigned P-high regressions only
      • [ ] Render Nominated Issues only
      • [ ] Render the full agenda
    • [ ] Announcements
    • [ ] Toolstate
    • [ ] Performance regressions
  • [ ] Propose a strategy to review all P-high issues
  • [ ] Add command for relabeling issues from Zulip #591.
  • [ ] Automatically beta/stable nominate a P-critical issue once it's fixed. Maybe P-high too?.
    • More info https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/should.20we.20consider.20I-unsound.20issues
  • [ ] Integrate Prioritization meeting automation with Zulip #579 .
but I guess I'd like first to focus on listening from people on ways to make our processes better
I think @apiraino was willing to help with triagebot automation
I want to better understand the CLI tool versus triagebot integration
is the idea that we can use the logic of the CLI tool as basis for triagebot?
@pnkfelix ohh great that you ask because most of the things there are unexplained :)
or the CLI tool just a stopgap measure until we can get triagebot integration up and running?

pnkfelix said:

is the idea that we can use the logic of the CLI tool as basis for triagebot?

exactly
okay
the cli was done because it was just the easiest way to get started and have something
are all the todo items you listed up there already implemented in CLI ?
looks likely to be the case
I'm slowly realizing that some things would be better if we split in several triagebot commands

pnkfelix said:

are all the todo items you listed up there already implemented in CLI ?

yes, all that is already implemented

LeSeulArtichaut said:

I think apiraino was willing to help with triagebot automation

I think also @Elinvynia had a wish to work on the bot (if I remember reading correctly on the other stream)
IIUC Triagebot is meant as a flexible tool, so I also think more commands is better
the cli does just one big run and returns everything
I think we can just split the different parts of it in different triagebot commands and be able to request those lists from here
you might be able to model that in the short term by making the CLI tool behave like a service
@apiraino Yep, I'm currently working on the label reassigning :)

pnkfelix said:

you might be able to model that in the short term by making the CLI tool behave like a service

(but this might also be waste of effort.)

apiraino said:

LeSeulArtichaut said:

I think apiraino was willing to help with triagebot automation

I think also Elinvynia had a wish to work on the bot (if I remember reading correctly on the other stream)

there are a lot of things to do in the bot so there's work for everyone willing to do some :smile:
By the way, is the issue with getting links for topics automatically resolved?

Elinvynia said:

apiraino Yep, I'm currently working on the label reassigning :)

good, to know, I'm going to put your name in the document
I mentioned that on the GH issue but didn't think about noting that in the document

Santiago Pastorino said:

Elinvynia said:

apiraino Yep, I'm currently working on the label reassigning :)

good, to know, I'm going to put your name in the document

we probably want to migrate all this stuff to github issues somehow
so we have some issues around organizing our tasks
the document idea I had is probably a very bad one :joy:

we probably want to migrate all this stuff to github issues somehow

That would be a separate prioritization-WG repository then? Or in compiler-team with a new label for the WG?
but on the other hand, given that our work is not only related to triagebot I'm not sure how we can do

LeSeulArtichaut said:

we probably want to migrate all this stuff to github issues somehow

That would be a separate repository then? Or in compiler-team with a new label for the WG?

I was thinking exactly about that ?

LeSeulArtichaut said:

we probably want to migrate all this stuff to github issues somehow

That would be a separate prioritization-WG repository then? Or in compiler-team with a new label for the WG?

maybe compiler-team and label prioritization? cc @pnkfelix
to be honest I'm not sure
Maybe we can cc people from the core team?
anyway, we can follow up on this on another topic
I guess @pnkfelix would have some good ideas here
so back to this question ...

Santiago Pastorino said:

but I guess I'd like first to focus on listening from people on ways to make our processes better

:point_up:
are there some cool ideas on how to improve?
Does this wg currently have a page on the forge site?
I'm personally satisfied about our async process

Elinvynia said:

Does this wg currently have a page on the forge site?

it doesn't, @o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur was going to build a document and kind of get a page started there. After that we can also list our procedure there
I think it runs fine, although it can sometimes feel like you don't know where to look

Elinvynia said:

Does this wg currently have a page on the forge site?

don't know If worth mentioning (or registering this somewhere), I 'd like to also have a look at moving the bot documentation from the github wiki to "the forge" see this stream

LeSeulArtichaut said:

I think it runs fine, although it can sometimes feel like you don't know where to look

yeah that's cool, my feeling is that things are getting better and better and I have more ideas on how to keep improving
part of those are what's in the document :)

LeSeulArtichaut said:

I think it runs fine, although it can sometimes feel like you don't know where to look

The proposed "pending lists" in triagebot will probably help
yes
to be honest, one of the main doubts I have is ...
so we open a topic for a set of different issues
prioritization ones are clear and good in my opinion, no doubt about those
about beta/stable nominations, I think those add more noise that solutions :), mainly once we are able to list them the day before the meeting
Also, since prioritization is triage in a way, are there any guidelines for when the triage-wg should add I-prioritize to issues?
about nominations, they may be closed before the meeting and we may spend time discussing things before hand
same about others
so unsure :)

Elinvynia said:

Also, since prioritization is triage in a way, are there any guidelines for when the triage-wg should add I-prioritize to issues?

So, If I were part of the triage-wg, I'd say that the most important work is to label regressions (those will automatically request prioritization) and maybe also add I-prioritize to the issues you feel are at minimum P-medium or P-high
in an ideal world we would prioritize all the issues
but we live in a non ideal world :)
so I'd try to spend prioritizing issues that seem more urgent
(50 issues to prioiritize is already a lot, I don't feel like prioritizing 5000+ issues is a good idea xD)
exactly :)
but not only that, we don't want even to prioritize all the new issues :)
Let's just do 49 per week then :heart:
I'm not sure how many we get per week

Elinvynia said:

Also, since prioritization is triage in a way, are there any guidelines for when the triage-wg should add I-prioritize to issues?

I think this doc from o0Ignition0o is a good starting point (just found it today ^_^)
https://hackmd.io/7NRRbq62TnaezW7-n15cDw

Santiago Pastorino said:

LeSeulArtichaut said:

we probably want to migrate all this stuff to github issues somehow

That would be a separate prioritization-WG repository then? Or in compiler-team with a new label for the WG?

maybe compiler-team and label prioritization? cc pnkfelix

(i'm personally inclined to have wg-prioritization allocate its own repository, at least initially. I think other wg's have used that pattern well...)

Santiago Pastorino said:

so we open a topic for a set of different issues

back to this, do you have any thought or cool idea?

pnkfelix said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

LeSeulArtichaut said:

we probably want to migrate all this stuff to github issues somehow

That would be a separate prioritization-WG repository then? Or in compiler-team with a new label for the WG?

maybe compiler-team and label prioritization? cc pnkfelix

(i'm personally inclined to have wg-prioritization allocate its own repository, at least initially. I think other wg's have used that pattern well...)

Felix, I don't think I have rights for that, can you?
let me see
i don't think I can create one. Let me check with niko about this

Santiago Pastorino said:

about beta/stable nominations, I think those add more noise that solutions :), mainly once we are able to list them the day before the meeting

I want to go back to this discussion that may have gone unnoticed
is people finding useful the topics that are automatically open?
I personally prefer to at least not get pinged for nominations
as there often isn't much I can do there

Santiago Pastorino said:

is people finding useful the topics that are automatically open?

For what I saw in the last two weeks, I find not a bad workflow to spawn a new topic for each issue. yes a lot of them, but they can be easily searched (I think) and there is lot of room for discussion (and evt triage)

lcnr said:

as there often isn't much I can do there

well I'm not sure if we have proper instructions on what to do there ?
i like the idea fo nominations, but i'm not sure what we do for the other cases

Santiago Pastorino said:

lcnr said:

as there often isn't much I can do there

well I'm not sure if we have proper instructions on what to do there ?

I was supposed to work on that :innocent:
by other cases i meant - ones marked p-critical, nominated issues

LeSeulArtichaut said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

lcnr said:

as there often isn't much I can do there

well I'm not sure if we have proper instructions on what to do there ?

I was supposed to work on that :innocent:

hehe, no worries, I was just wondering if people know what we are supposed to do given the lack of instructions

lcnr said:

I personally prefer to at least not get pinged for nominations

could be an idea to have a sub-group of pinged ppl instead of @WG-prioritization?
cc @lcnr :point_up:, well I meant to point my message above, not @apiraino's one :)
:laughing: not really
:), yeah I was guessing that
IIRC the goal was to prepare the agenda entry for the next meeting
right
we are going there :)
apirainos idea would be nice. I don't have a lot of time rn, but still want to keep up with pings
there are a lot of unorganized things right now
We had things ready for I-pri and I-nom I think

apiraino said:

lcnr said:

I personally prefer to at least not get pinged for nominations

could be an idea to have a sub-group of pinged ppl instead of @WG-prioritization?

I strongly second this, pings bothers me a TON :slight_smile:
Once a sub-group is ready, again, changing the messages only requires to change the triagebot.toml file
I'm playing with my daughter and I'm pinged by a Rust issue
:joy:
Now I feel bad for pinging you the other day :sweat_smile:
Mute the notifs :D
hehe :)

Elinvynia said:

Now I feel bad for pinging you the other day :sweat_smile:

Ah, that rain of pings, we all remember xD
at least you can mute here and not in your email ;)
Disabled the emails entirely

LeSeulArtichaut said:

Once a sub-group is ready, again, changing the messages only requires to change the triagebot.toml file

we were talking with nikomatsakis about an schema like that
maybe people don't want to be pinged because they don't know what to do further on those threads?
But at the same time groups are only useful for pinging, right?

DPC said:

maybe people don't want to be pinged because they don't know what to do further on those threads?

I dont know (yet) what to do but I wish to be pinged to learn the workflow here ( <-- counterexample)
sorry, because I think I was confusing things with my previous message
I think we can have 2 groups yeah

what i mean is -
on i-prioritize threads people don't mind getting pinged because they need to comment on the issue

LeSeulArtichaut said:

But at the same time groups are only useful for pinging, right?

yes, we can make triagebot use one group and for meetings we would use the other one
for nominated & other threads - people prefer to not be pinged because they don't have to do any work on teh thread
About the procedures I had this topic open.

Santiago Pastorino said:

LeSeulArtichaut said:

But at the same time groups are only useful for pinging, right?

yes, we can make triagebot use one group and for meetings we would use the other one

Seems like the better solution to me

DPC said:

for nominated & other threads - people prefer to not be pinged because they don't have to do any work on teh thread

yeah, so we need to do some work there :)
so maybe if we could clarify what's the process for nominated issues, people might not be concerned with the ping :D
or I meant, somebody at some point needs to do some work there

DPC said:

for nominated & other threads - people prefer to not be pinged because they don't have to do any work on teh thread

I think even not pinging would be feasible too, because only one person is needed to write the agenda entry
in particular I'm sold with having 2 groups because pings bothers me
if I mute I also mute DMs and I don't want that
to be fair, wg-prioritization does need to deal with nominated issues
its just that it deals with them lazily
and the I-nominated tag suffices for that
just in case, we were talking about the topic that is automatically created for them

pnkfelix said:

to be fair, wg-prirotizations does need to deal with nominated issues

Currently what we do is preparing the agenda entry for the meeting, is there something else we'd need to do?
(by "need to deal with them", I mean "decide which ones to put on agenda for each week".)
we seem to be confused if we need to do something with the stuff that happens in the topic or not

pnkfelix said:

(by "need to deal with them", I mean "decide which ones to put on agenda for each week".)

exactly
@LeSeulArtichaut yeah that's all I'm talking about
Oh I see what you mean sorry
but it seems like the group have some confusion about it, which will be addressed in a follow up PR that explains what to do once a topic is opened
btw, I've documented that in a not great way but there's something here ...

Santiago Pastorino said:

we seem to be confused if we need to do something with the stuff that happens in the topic or not

oh I'm sorry, I thought you all were talking about wanting to get rid of github pings for I-nominated issues?

Santiago Pastorino said:

but it seems like the group have some confusion about it, which will be addressed in a follow up PR that explains what to do once a topic is opened

Just remind me to make progress here. I'm like a future, I need to be polled :rolling_eyes:
were you talking about zulip pings or something?
https://hackmd.io/WJ0G17DHTHGgv0OW9I2PxA?view#I-nominated

pnkfelix said:

were you talking about zulip pings or something?

Zulip pings, yes
ah I misunderstood the complaint there

LeSeulArtichaut said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

but it seems like the group have some confusion about it, which will be addressed in a follow up PR that explains what to do once a topic is opened

Just remind me to make progress here. I'm like a future, I need to be polled :rolling_eyes:

don't even say that, otherwise you will be frequently polled :joy:

Santiago Pastorino said:

LeSeulArtichaut said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

but it seems like the group have some confusion about it, which will be addressed in a follow up PR that explains what to do once a topic is opened

Just remind me to make progress here. I'm like a future, I need to be polled :rolling_eyes:

don't even say that, otherwise you will be frequently polled :joy:

Perfect :D
@LeSeulArtichaut is it ready now?

Santiago Pastorino said:

https://hackmd.io/WJ0G17DHTHGgv0OW9I2PxA?view#I-nominated

we have documented there what to do with I-nominated
and in that same document you can do what to do with the rest
but the idea would be to include that text, shaped a bit better as the first line of the topic
so we are constantly reminded of what to do
and also let's not forget that new contributors may join the group :)
20 mins left
I think we can talk briefly about automations that we have in our tasks
just throwing in an idea - would members benefit if every thread opens with a small paragraph about what is supposed to be done?

DPC said:

just throwing in an idea - would members benefit if every thread opens with a small paragraph about what is supposed to be done?

That was the idea @Santiago Pastorino proposed, I think
yes, that's the idea
if you all agree, let's discuss some automations
srry haven't followed every message in today's meeting :slight_smile:
no worries

Santiago Pastorino said:

if you all agree, let's discuss some automations

and maybe some people want to get some tasks :)

• [ ] Implement @triagebot commands for each step of our procedure
    • [ ] Unprioritized I-prioritize pending list
    • [ ] Unprioritized Regressions pending list
    • [ ] Nominations pending list
    • [ ] PRs waiting on team pending list
    • [ ] Agenda
      • [ ] Render MCP section only
      • [ ] Render Beta nominations only
      • [ ] Render Stable nominations only
      • [ ] Render PRs waiting on team only
      • [ ] Render Issues of note short summary only
      • [ ] Render Issues of note P-critical only
      • [ ] Render Issues of note Unassigned P-high regressions only
      • [ ] Render Nominated Issues only
      • [ ] Render the full agenda
    • [ ] Announcements
    • [ ] Toolstate
    • [ ] Performance regressions
  • [ ] [Elinvynia] Add command for relabeling issues from Zulip #591.
  • [ ] Automatically beta/stable nominate a P-critical issue once it's fixed. Maybe P-high too?.
    • More info https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/should.20we.20consider.20I-unsound.20issues
this is more or less the complete list of "pending" automations
my .2 cents about "[ ] Implement @triagebot commands for each step of our procedure". should we first define the UI of the bot then say we need to implement X,Y and Z cmds?
yes, that's the first thing we would need to do
and then we can also split the subtasks
yes
I think the first main task is that one
come up with a set of commands for triagebot
ideas are welcome
something was proposed in this stream I'll recap here for brevity

Command: @triagebot prioritize i-prioritize
retrieve all I-prioritize issues

Command: @triagebot prioritize i-prioritize.t-compiler
retrieve three separate issues lists

Command: @triagebot list I-priotitize + T-compiler
alternative syntax
( :up: checked this stuff today)
yeah that's cool
oh I was the one that proposed that :joy:
it kind of clicked to me, I see that's why
@LeSeulArtichaut you that have played more with triagebot, how easy would be to do something like that?
if no alternate proposal arise, we can move this draft to a more concrete proposal
I guess the main problem is how well the triagebot infraestructure will play with commands like those
unsure how are commands parsed today
I guess we don't want to make this overcomplex and end spending 90% of the time tweaking the command parsing code

also checked that one :-)
here a sample POST done by your cmdline tool

POST /https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/api/v1/messages
Auth: `BOT_EMAIL:bot_api_token`
request = {
    "type": "stream",
    "to": "t-compiler/wg-prioritization",
    "topic": "I-prioritize #123456 Issue title",
    "content": "Issue title (maybe)",
}
I might suggest

Santiago Pastorino said:

LeSeulArtichaut you that have played more with triagebot, how easy would be to do something like that?

Listing issues support pagination, but there was the idea to use XAMPPRocky's lib octocrab for that
if there is a regular recipe that is followed every week
then you might consider having alias for the commands

LeSeulArtichaut said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

LeSeulArtichaut you that have played more with triagebot, how easy would be to do something like that?

Listing issues support pagination, but there was the idea to use XAMPPRocky's lib octocrab for that

for now is not an issue :)
that corresponds to steps in the recipe
e.g. @triagebot step1
and it would do the first thing (and spell out the full command for it, perhaps, so that you can redo it and refine it if necessary)
yeah I guess at some point I'd like a meta command that runs a bunch of commands
maybe @triagebot agenda step1 or something like that; no need to assume that this recipe is the only one you'll ever need
right
I'm just figuring that it would be a shame to have to reference a document to know what commands to run
something like that is what we want I guess
but I will note that I do like having the expressive command forms available
cc @simulacrum for the triagebot questions

apiraino said:

POST /https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/api/v1/messages
Auth: `BOT_EMAIL:bot_api_token`
request = {
    "type": "stream",
    "to": "t-compiler/wg-prioritization",
    "topic": "I-prioritize #123456 Issue title",
    "content": "Issue title (maybe)",
}

Antonio, I'm not sure what did you mean
I was mainly wondering what is triagebot current code able to parse as command

Santiago Pastorino said:

unsure how are commands parsed today

I think parsing is done in a token by token basis

Santiago Pastorino

Antonio, I'm not sure what did you mean

nevermind, sorry I misunderstood
So you parse words, punctuation, etc... and you can iterate through them

pnkfelix said:

maybe @triagebot agenda step1 or something like that; no need to assume that this recipe is the only one you'll ever need

this would work well if all steps are done in sync, else people may heve to check which step is what

LeSeulArtichaut said:

So you parse words, punctuation, etc... and you can iterate through them

well that sounds good
So I don't think implementing the command syntax you proposed would be too hard
cool
let's do the following then
I'm going to come up with a full proposal for these commands
list them on a topic and we can discuss and improve
meanwhile if people want to work on some of the automation regardless would be great
mainly given that, some are independent of this
and some that depend we could just change the command name and args if the work is done before defining this
in particular

• [ ] [Elinvynia] Add command for relabeling issues from Zulip #591.
  • [ ] Automatically beta/stable nominate a P-critical issue once it's fixed. Maybe P-high too?.
    • More info https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/should.20we.20consider.20I-unsound.20issues
these two are independent
and also the one we were talking with @LeSeulArtichaut, the one about adding some explanation about what to do on each topic

• Add command for relabeling issues from Zulip #591.

This is going to be a life saver I think. Would also be great to have a command to retrieve the link to the current channel, which is hard to do e.g. on a phone
yes
a weird suggestion - we could do a dry run. Let someone act as if these are implemented and type the commands and another person acts like the "bot" and fetches it
last week I went over zillions of issues and ended not adding links because it was taking too much time

DPC said:

a weird suggestion - we could do a dry run. Let someone act as if these are implemented and type the commands and another person acts like the "bot" and fetches it

I can do. I'm used to copy-pasting :joy:

DPC said:

a weird suggestion - we could do a dry run. Let someone act as if these are implemented and type the commands and another person acts like the "bot" and fetches it

you meant, as a way of showing what the commands needs to do?
yes also that way it may be easier to plan out how the commands should look like
:+1:
anyway should be easy to figure out by running the cli
because the work is already done
what we need is to connect it to a triagebot command
I may be able to do one that serves as an example
and then would be easier to implement the rest I think
well we are almost on time
to wrap up
@pnkfelix can you figure out the repo? as soon as we have that I can create issues there
I'm going to make a proposal for triagebot commands and share here
@Elinvynia is working on "Add command for relabeling issues from Zulip #591."
@LeSeulArtichaut needs to be pinged about adding explanations of what to do to each topic :)
the rest of the tasks are here https://hackmd.io/P3yvagSSS7yAI2QxhLfPtQ?view#Tasks if someone wants to work on something feel free to add your name and do not hesitate to ask for help
if no one has anything else to share, I guess we can close this meeting ...
I have some questions about the Agenda part but ok to talk about it with you @Santiago Pastorino async
@WG-prioritization well I guess that's all for the main meeting :wave:

apiraino said:

I have some questions about the Agenda part but ok to talk about it with you Santiago Pastorino async

let's continue in this topic anyway
tell me
was just wondering if the output split for the Agenda you suggest in the hackmd is relevant to the triaging bot discussion we had right now

these tasks, namely

 Agenda
    Render MCP section only
    Render Beta nominations only
    Render Stable nominations only
    Render PRs waiting on team only
    Render Issues of note short summary only
    Render Issues of note P-critical only
    Render Issues of note Unassigned P-high regressions only
    Render Nominated Issues only
    Render the full agenda
maybe I dont have clear why are they under the triagebot commands main section of the todo list
sorry, I think I didn't properly understood what you meant
yeah, me neither :-)
what is the output split for the agenda that I have suggested?
I guess the question I have here is what would the UI be?
what part of the discussion are you referring to?
ok first question: does the output of the agenda depends on the bot output or is that a kind of "summary" of the previous commands?
so ... right now the cli writes to console each of the steps we follow
let me try to explain from scratch just in case
right now our cli runs, make a lot of github queries about a lot of things we need to discuss, like i-nominated issues, beta/stable nominated issues, i-prioritize issues and so on
and it also make some queries to build the agenda
all that is right now done "sync", like all at once
we are moving towards a thing that running everything at once does not make sense
because we are doing the work as we go
for instance, listing i-prioritize or nightly/beta regressions won't make sense because we are asynchronously requested to prioritize those
but still we may want to request what's pending about those
anyway ... the idea of the next work and the "proper" integration with triagebot that I had in mind is about
1. first to be able to do @triagebot something something and have a part of our process running
that basically means being able to run our script from here
and instead of having the cli asking us press any key to continue or stuff like that, we would have a command per section
what I'm proposing is a mixture between not running everything at once and allow us to run the parts of the script we want
we could also do that in the console program
but in my opinion we would be winning zero
after that, the proposal is just to integrate that with triagebot
it's basically just that
unsure if this explains more or less but feel free to keep asking until is clear
ok so far, it's clear. So, in short is a command to build the agenda.md needed at all ?
I may not be easy for me to explain this in english and I may be entangling everything :)

apiraino said:

ok so far, it's clear. So, in short is a command to build the agenda.md needed at all ?

to be honest, there are things that are not 100% clear for me, I have been realizing about things as we go
